alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Kofa; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 12:20AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central La Paz, northeastern Yuma and Maricopa Counties through 100 AM MST... At 1220 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Sundad, or 16 miles southwest of Tonopah, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central La Paz, northeastern Yuma and Maricopa Counties. This includes AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 58 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Kofa; Tonopah Desert
